content:
1. enroll_in_espp: An intention to enroll in an ESPP. Requires the following parameters: company_stock, payroll_deduction, number_of_shares. Example utterance: "I want to invest in my company's stock, so I am enrolling in the Employee Stock Purchase Plan."

2. cancel_espp_enrollment: An intention to cancel enrollment in an ESPP. No parameters required. Example utterance: "I changed my mind; please cancel my enrollment in the Employee Stock Purchase Plan."

3. change_espp_deduction: An intention to change the amount deducted from which compensation to the ESPP. No parameters required. Example utterance: "I want to change the amount deducted from my commissions to my Employee Stock Purchase Plan."

4. espp_sell: An intention to sell ESPP shares. No parameters required. Example utterance: "I want to sell some of my company stock through the Employee Stock Purchase Plan."

5. check_espp_eligibility: An intention to determine if an employee is eligible for an ESPP. No parameters required. Example utterance: "Am I eligible to participate in the Employee Stock Purchase Plan?"

6. compensation_type_espp: An intention to understand what types of compensation are included for deduction to contribute to the Employee Stock Purchase Program. No parameters required. Example utterance: "Will all of my compensation be deducted from for espp?"

Given the above actions available, select all that apply to the following email inquiry.

To: Mark Olmstadt
From: Marian Landsby
Date: Fri 10/20/2023 10:22 AM
Subject: ESPP question

Hey Mark,

Just a quick question. I was reading the below and am really having a hard time figuring out what I need to do.

How much can I contribute to my ESPP?

In most countries participants can contribute up to 15% of your cash compensation during each Offering Period. You may elect to authorize payroll deductions in 1% increments from a minimum of 1% to a maximum of 15% of your gross "compensation".  

For purposes of ServiceNow's ESPP, your "compensation" means all cash compensation, including without limitation base salary or regular hourly wages, bonuses, incentive compensation, commissions, overtime, shift premiums, plus draws against commissions (or in foreign jurisdictions, equivalent cash compensation).

How often can I change my payroll deductions?

You may increase or decrease the level of your payroll deductions for any subsequent Offering Period by changing your contribution amount during an ESPP open enrollment window online through your Fidelity account.

Once the ESPP open enrollment window ends, you cannot make any increases to your payroll deductions. You may make changes to decrease the level of your payroll deductions only ONCE during an active Offering Period online through your Fidelity account. Once you decrease your contribution amount during an active Offering Period, the new rate will continue for the remainder of the Offering Period, unless you withdraw from ESPP.

You may further reduce your payroll deduction percentage to zero (0) during an active Offering Period online through your Fidelity account. You may not resume making payroll deductions for the duration of the active Offering Period in which you reduce your payroll deduction to zero (0). Payroll deductions credited to you prior to the date your request is effective will be used to purchase shares on the Purchase Date; however, you may withdraw the credited amount back to you by completing the withdrawal process through your Fidelity account. If you proceed with withdrawing the credited amount, the amount will be refunded to you via your paycheck. Refunds may take 1-2 pay cycles.

I really don't want any of my bonus money going to the ESPP. 

Please help me out and tell me what I need to do.

Marian

______________

Provide your output in a json, including only the names of the actions that may apply.  If no actions should be selected, please return the value Not Applicable.
